page.title: 20Summary of Life in Knockholt
page.content: The village has its Senior Citizens' and Lunch Club and transport is provided for those who have none, to foot clinics etc. A daily prescription rota is manned, with deliveries to patients. There is one Neighbourhood Watch group and others are proposed. Many house to house collections, fetes, bazaars and coffee mornings are held for various charities and much local interest is taken in such questions as stubble burning. There is no local police station in Knockholt now and this is much regetted. Access to health services is difficult, particularly for those without their own transport. We find Knockholt a friendly and helpful village in which to live with many activities for all ages. Delving into our village history and enviroment has been a rewarding task. {Knockholt Womens Institute.
